title: Savings
body:
**Everyone wants to make sure they have a bright future,** and saving regularly is a great way to help make sure that your future needs are taken care of. Whether you are saving for education fees, planning for retirement, or for future financial security, regular investing could be the answer.

For many people this simply meant putting money on deposit. Household deposits with Irish banks were **€151bn** at the end of March 2023, compared to €110bn at the end of 2019 and €83bn at the end of 2007. (CSO Household Savings, Q1 2023).

With deposit account interest rates not matching inflation, many families and investors are experiencing a considerable loss in the real value of their money and are looking for alternatives.

Talk to a financial advisor who will help you identify the most appropriate savings options for you, and the risks involved.

Warning: The value of your investment may go down as well as up.
